availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. McBrayer (Anderson County clerk and prov govt)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, clerk, farmer, and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. McBrayer. Father of Enfield McBrayer, Harvey S. McBrayer, Jennie A. McBrayer, Lucien B. McBrayer, Elbridge D. McBrayer, and Susie L. McBrayer. Clerk in Anderson County in 1850. Farmer in Anderson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Farmer in Anderson County in 1863.
